meanings.definition: To add punctuation marks to a piece of writing.
meanings.sent1: She carefully repunctuated her essay to make it easier to read.
meanings.sent2: I always repunctuate my emails before sending them out.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to repunctuate the student's messy paper to make sense of it.
meanings.sent4: His editing skills were so sharp, it was like he could repunctuate thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The writer's job is to repunctuate words to guide the reader smoothly.

meanings.definition: The act of revising or correcting punctuation in a text.
meanings.sent1: The repunctuation of the manuscript took longer than expected.
meanings.sent2: Proper repunctuation is crucial for clear communication.
meanings.sent3: The repunctuation of the old book revealed many errors.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail in repunctuation was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The repunctuation of the document transformed it into a masterpiece.
